history.proof: intros d a b H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. apply H1.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall d a b : nat, is_gcd d a b -> divides a d

Premises:
is_gcd = fun d a b : nat => is_cd d a b /\ (forall d' : nat, is_cd d' a b -> divides d d') : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd_sym : forall d a b : nat, is_gcd d a b -> is_gcd d b a
gcd_unique : forall d d' a b : nat, is_gcd d a b -> is_gcd d' a b -> d = d'
gcd_minus : forall d a b : nat, a <= b -> is_gcd d a b < -> is_gcd d a (b - a)
divides_minus : forall d a b : nat, divides a d -> divides b d -> divides (b - a) d
divides_plus : forall d a b : nat, divides a d -> divides b d -> divides (a + b) d
divides_mult : forall d a b : nat, divides a d -> divides (a * b) d
is_cd = fun d a b : nat => divides a d /\ divides b d : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_cd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
divides_antisym : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> divides b a -> a = b
divides_trans : forall a b c : nat, divides a b -> divides b c -> divides a c
divides_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> divides a b -> b <= a
quo_dec : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> {q : nat | a = b * q}
quo : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> nat
quo_is_quo : forall (a b : nat) (H : divides a b), a = b * quo a b H
quo_mult : forall (a b : nat) (H : divides a b) (n : nat), b <> 0 -> quo (a * n) b (divides_mult b a n H) = n * quo a b H
divides_dec : forall a b : nat, {divides a b} + {~ divides a b}
divides_euclide : forall (a b : nat) (H : b <> 0), divides a b < -> remainder_euclide a b H = 0
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
euclide_unique : forall a b q r q' r' : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q + r -> a = b * q' + r' -> r < b -> r' < b -> q = q' /\ r = r'
quo_rem_euclide : forall (a b : nat) (H : b <> 0), a = b * quotient_euclide a b H + remainder_euclide a b H
gcd_refl : forall a : nat, is_gcd a a a
gcd_zero : forall a : nat, is_gcd a 0 a
non_div_1 : forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> ~ divides 1 a
gcd_one : forall a : nat, is_gcd 1 1 a
rem_euclide : forall (a b : nat) (H : b <> 0), remainder_euclide a b H < b
divides_refl : forall a : nat, divides a a
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
VectorDef.append = fix append (A : Type) (n p : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A n) (w : VectorDef.t A p) {struct v} : VectorDef.t A (n + p) := match v in (VectorDef.t _ n0) return (VectorDef.t A (n0 + p)) with | VectorDef.nil _ => w | VectorDef.cons _ a n0 v' => VectorDef.cons A a (n0 + p) (append A n0 p v' w) end : forall (A : Type) (n p : nat), VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A p -> VectorDef.t A (n + p) Arguments VectorDef.append {A}%type_scope {n p}%nat_scope
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
power_divides_power : forall x n m : nat, x > 1 -> divides (power x n) (power x m) -> m <= n
zero_max_div : forall n : nat, divides 0 n
one_min_div : forall n : nat, divides n 1
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
dec_impl_lt_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}
lt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, m < n0 -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
VectorDef.t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop), P 0 (VectorDef.nil A) -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t -> P (S n) (VectorDef.cons A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t

destruct H as [H1 H2].
apply H1.
